result.execSummary:
All charges against Thomas A Nondahl in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas A Nondahl is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas A Nondahl

records.addlTxt: 1:39 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Attorney Raymond Henry LaBarge in court for Thomas A Nondahl.  Attorney appears by authorization. Court inquires as to the status of the case.  Mr. Marrufo advises they have received verification the defendant has completed the treatment and moves to have the case dismissed. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. Atty. LaBarge has no objection.  Court will order the case dismissed with prejudice.
Filed by Atty LaBarge confirming with Court that he can appear by authorization at the next hearing.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Motion and Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement(s) signed by Judge Laura Lau July 18, 2022.
